meanings.definition: To make a deep, resonant sound like a dog
meanings.sent1: The dog was bowwowing loudly in the yard.
meanings.sent2: I heard a dog bowwowing in the distance.
meanings.sent3: The bowwowing of the dog startled the birds nearby.
meanings.sent4: His voice bowwowed through the empty hallways.
meanings.sent5: The sound of bowwowing echoed through the forest.

meanings.definition: The act of barking loudly and continuously
meanings.sent1: The bowwowing of the dog kept me up all night.
meanings.sent2: His bowwowing was so loud that it echoed in the valley.
meanings.sent3: The bowwowing of the dog interrupted the peaceful evening.
meanings.sent4: The bowwowing of the dog was like a constant drumbeat.
meanings.sent5: The bowwowing of the dog filled the neighborhood with noise.

meanings.definition: A loud, deep bark, typically made by a large dog
meanings.sent1: The bowwowing of the Great Dane could be heard for miles.
meanings.sent2: I recognized the bowwowing of my neighbor's Mastiff.
meanings.sent3: The bowwowing of the dog made everyone turn their heads.
meanings.sent4: The bowwowing of the dog was like thunder in the quiet park.
meanings.sent5: The bowwowing of the dog reverberated through the night.
